news_header: Sunandan Das, an Indian snake expert, works at the University of Helsinki and has a passion for reptiles, particularly snakes. He has a collection of toxic snakes and has made significant contributions to herpetology, including the discovery of a new snake tribe.
news_text: Sunandan Das, originally from Kolkata, India, is a snake expert currently residing in Helsinki, where he works at the University of Helsinki. He has a collection of toxic snakes and a king boa named Mad Baby. Das's fascination with snakes began in childhood, influenced by his supportive parents. He studied zoology and has made significant contributions to the field, including the discovery of a new tribe of snakes, Micrelapidae. His research focuses on the evolution and genetics of reptiles, and he emphasizes the importance of biodiversity and conservation in the face of climate change.
